intro: Eriogonum effusum var. fendlerianum, commonly known as the Fendler’s globemallow, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its woolly, gray-green foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. This species is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub habitats.
